column2: Department Incharge: An individual responsible for overseeing and managing a specific department within an organization, such as a Sales Incharge, Production Incharge, or HR Incharge      Their responsibilities typically include setting goals, managing the team, and ensuring the department meets its objectives      Shift Incharge: In settings like manufacturing or operations, a Shift Incharge is responsible for supervising and coordinating the activities of a particular shift, ensuring smooth operations, and handling any issues or emergencies that may arise during that shift      Facility Incharge: An individual responsible for the management and maintenance of a facility, which can include a variety of responsibilities like security, maintenance, and ensuring a safe and efficient working environment      Project Incharge: In project management, a Project Incharge oversees the planning, execution, and successful completion of a specific project      They are responsible for managing project resources, timelines, and objectives      Unit InCharge: In some organizations, there are units or specific areas within a department, and a Unit Incharge is responsible for managing and leading that particular unit's operations and performance
column11: IT skills, PSM, Management, Public health, Teaching

column2: Slim. in,  a lifestyle change based weight management intervention is looking for Psychologists to deliver its group programmes in communities across India.  It is a unique opportunity to work with an innovative,  young company introducing Psychology to lifestyle related health issues at scale.  The intervention has been developed with inputs from psychology & nutrition and consists of weekly 1. 5 hour sessions.  It incorporates the latest research in behaviour change around weight management following a comprehensive literature review.  India is the third largest obese country in the world with more than 30mn people with obesity.  If one includes people who are overweight,  this number jumps to 100mn.  Obesity is linked to a significant number of health challenges including diabetes which affects more than 60mn people in India.  Globally,  3 risk factors (poor diet,  lack of physical activity and tobacco use) are linked to four diseases that account for 50% of deaths.  Slim. in deals with two out of the three factors for now,  and plans to develop an intervention for the third (tobacco) soon.  Slim. in was published in Health:  Our Business (PDF,  5mb) ,  an initiative to find innovative interventions by the Global Chief Medical Officers network as part of the Clinton Global Initiative.  Locations  We are currently recruiting for Mumbai and Navi Mumbai.  Responsibilities  In short,  it is the programme leader s responsibility to ensure that every participant is successful in losing weight and keeping it off.  In broad terms,  this means the following  Deliver 1. 5 hour sessions to groups of up to 20 people.  Each group meets once a week   Meet every potential attendee and assess their suitability for slim. in meetings (stages of change assessment,  motivational interviewing,  explaining how slim. in can help,  etc)   Regularly conduct free slim. in taster sessions.  These give useful information about healthy eating and showcase how slim. in works   Record participant s measurement data   Continuously improve the intervention   Over time,  contribute to research literature around weight loss interventions In addition to the above clinical responsibilities,  the Leader will also be responsible for operational elements around delivering the meetings including,  but not limited to,  billing,  printing and distributing handouts (if necessary) and the like.  Over time,  we will look at interesting ways to make a wider impact on society.  This could include training community ambassadors to disseminate healthy living messages,  speaking at schools and colleges about healthy eating and creating/ executing interventions that can be delivered at scale by non- professionals.  Qualifications and Skills  Leaders will need to have bilingual fluency in English and at least one regional language to conduct group sessions.  Educational qualifications   Bachelor's degree in psychology with at least five years of experience in the field of mental health OR   Master's degree in psychology with at least two years of experience in the field of mental health OR   Pre- doctoral (M. Phil) or doctoral degree in Psychology   Candidates with significant experience are encouraged to apply Skills   Empathy is key to being a successful slim. in Programme Leader   Voracious reader,  and an ability to assimilate information quickly   Genuine interest in helping people   Experience of /  demonstrated comfort in handling small groups of 12 -  20 people   Ability to work independently   Comfortable with technology.  We use a variety of IT tools to manage our operations   Interdisciplinary bent of mind Salary  Salary is not a constraint for the right candidate Hours of operation  We are looking for full- time and part- time professionals.  Please indicate your preference while completing the application form
column11: Printing, English, Group, PDF, Nutrition, Psychology, Billing, Tools, Time, Operations

column2: We are looking for knowledgeable Dieticians who are passionate about helping patients achieve their goals and lead healthier lives. Dieticians will work according to the ProGen Method protocol and need to develop trusting partnerships with their patients. They may also participate and create training, demonstrations, and seminars to inform the public about the ProGen Method and to promote healthier lifestyle habits.      They should be analytical, caring, and knowledgeable with good communication, active listening, problem-solving and computer skills. They should be passionate public speakers who can get others excited about health and the ProGen Method.        Dietician responsibilities:          Listening to patients to know about their goals and challenges.          Prescribing the nutrition plan and physical activity according to the ProGen Method.          Compiling information and tracking patient progress towards their health goals.          Entering patient information in the database.          Speaking to groups to promote the ProGen Method and to promote health.          Dietician requirements:          Bachelor s Degree in nutrition.          Additional education or experience may be preferred.          Licenses or additional certifications may be required.          Exceptional communication, problem-solving, public speaking and listening skills.          Willingness to continue training and research to keep updated about the latest discoveries and developments in the field.          Strong computer and data entry skills.          Compassion and genuine interest in helping others develop better eating habits.

column2: A hospital administrator, also known as a healthcare administrator or healthcare executive, is responsible for overseeing the efficient and effective operation of a hospital or healthcare facility      They work closely with medical staff, department heads, and other administrative personnel to ensure the delivery of high-quality patient care and the smooth functioning of the organization        Here is a typical job description for a hospital administrator:        Strategic Planning: Develop and implement strategic plans and objectives for the hospital, in alignment with the organization's mission and goals      Evaluate and monitor the performance of various departments and identify areas for improvement      Financial Management: Manage the hospital's budget, including revenue generation, expense control, and financial forecasting      Ensure proper allocation of resources and identify opportunities to optimize financial performance      Regulatory Compliance: Stay updated with healthcare laws, regulations, and accreditation standards      Ensure the hospital's compliance with these requirements, including patient safety, privacy, and quality standards      Staff Management: Recruit, hire, and supervise administrative and support staff      Provide leadership and guidance to department heads and other employees, fostering a positive work environment and promoting professional development      Patient Care Quality: Collaborate with medical staff to ensure the delivery of high-quality patient care      Implement quality improvement initiatives, monitor patient satisfaction, and address any concerns or complaints      Facility Operations: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the hospital, including maintenance, security, and housekeeping      Ensure a safe and comfortable environment for patients, visitors, and staff      Information Management: Implement and maintain health information systems and electronic medical records      Ensure the privacy and security of patient data and facilitate information sharing among healthcare providers      Community Relations: Build and maintain relationships with community organizations, healthcare providers, and government agencies      Promote the hospital's services and programs through community outreach and engagement      Emergency Preparedness: Develop and implement emergency response plans to address potential disasters or public health crises      Coordinate with relevant agencies and ensure the hospital's readiness to handle emergencies      Strategic Partnerships: Identify and develop partnerships with other healthcare organizations, suppliers, and vendors      Collaborate on initiatives to enhance patient care, improve operational efficiency, and drive cost savings
column11: Housekeeping, Administration, Patient care, Strategic planning, Healthcare, Information management, medical records, Forecasting, Operations, Facility operations
